etymology.description: Pictogram of a bow firing an arrow; hand (攴(攴) (pū, "tap")) added later -> evolved into phonetic component 癹(癹) (bá) -> final form as phono-semantic
etymology.interpretation: The original depiction of a bow and arrow represents the act of emitting or issuing, like launching an arrow. The hand component implies control, leading to the contemporary concept of issuing or emitting something.
etymology.simplification: Simplified to 发(發) by merging functions of 髮(髮) (fà, "hair") in the 1956 Chinese Character Simplification Scheme, as both share the pronunciation.

examples.chinese: 电台发出柔和的音乐(電台發出柔和的音樂)。
厂房发出刺鼻的气味(廠房發出刺鼻的氣味)。
examples.english: The factory emits a pungent odor.

examples.chinese: 汽车发出急促的鸣笛(汽車發出急促的鳴笛)，警告行人靠边行走(警告行人靠邊行走)。
examples.pinyin: Qìchē fāchū jí cù de míngdí, jǐnggào xíngrén kào biān xíngzǒu。
examples.english: The car emits a rapid honk, warning pedestrians to move aside.
